entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 11:16AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels on Interior Rivers this Weekend... Temperatures warming into the 70`s over the Memorial Day weekend will result in increased snowmelt runoff from higher elevations. This will bring rising water levels to Interior rivers that still have a significant snowpack in their headwaters. This includes rivers draining the Alaska Range and the Tanana-Yukon Uplands. Water

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued May 28 at 2:24PM MDT until May 31 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SUNDAY TO NOON MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy, wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of one to two feet. Local totals up to around 30 inches over the southern end of the Absaroka Mountains. Northeast wind gusting 25 to 40 mph.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued May 28 at 2:24PM MDT until May 31 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SUNDAY TO NOON MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy, wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of one to two feet. Localized amounts up to around 30 inches. Northeast wind gusting 25 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Bighorn Mountains West and Bighorn Mountains Southeast.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued May 28 at 2:24PM MDT until May 31 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM SUNDAY TO NOON MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 20 inches, especially above the 8000 foot elevation. Total snowfall over South Pass will range from 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Wind River Mountains East.
